data.text:
Harry S. Truman Library

Location: Holmstedt Hall 304

Contact" Email: polisci@indstate.edu

Phone: 812.237.2430

This Library is dedicated to the memory of Dr. Robert Thompson. Dr. Thompson served many roles at Indiana State University, including Executive Vice President of the University Foundation, Interim Vice President of University Advancement, Assistant Vice President for Public Affairs, Director of University Community Relations, Director of Marketing, and Professor of Marketing. His years of dedicated service to the campus was greatly appreciated by his Indiana State University colleagues, and his commitment to student success and education is remembered by hundreds of his former students.

The Harry S. Truman Library was generously donated to the ISU Department of Political Science. It is open to students and scholars alike interested in studying President Truman. The Library contains selected newspaper clippings and books. Some of the Library’s content is as follows:

BOOKS ON HARRY S. TRUMAN AND HIS ERA

1. Year of Decisions, 1945, volume 1, Harry S. Truman

2. Years of Trial and Hope, 1946-1952, volume 2, Harry S. Truman

3. The Man of Independence, Jonathan Daniels

4. Man of the People, Alonzo L. Hamby

5. Harry S. Truman, Robert H. Ferrell

6. Truman, David McCullough

7. Conflict and Crisis, Robert J. Donovan

8. Tumultuous Years, Robert J. Donovan

9. Harry S. Truman, Margaret Truman

10. Truman, Roy Jenkins

11. Off the Record, The Private Papers of Harry S. Truman, edited by Robert H. Ferrell

12. Truman the Rise to Power, Richard Lawrence Miller

13. Harry S. Truman, Robert H. Ferrell [small paperback]

14. The Autobiography of Harry S. Truman, Robert H. Ferrell

18. Harry Truman and Civil Rights, Moral Courage and Political Risks, Michael R. Gardner

22. Harry Truman and the Human Family, Frank K. Kelly

23. The Truman Presidency, Cabell Phillips

28. The Most Noble Adventure, the Marshall Plan and When America Helped Save Europe, Greg Behrman

29. Harry S. Truman and the Fair Deal, Alonzo L. Hamby

30. The Truman Doctrine and the Origins of McCarthyism, Richard M. Freeland

31. Working With Truman, Ken Hechler

35. Acheson, James Chace

37. Affection and Trust, The Personal Correspondence of Harry S. Truman and Dean Acheson, 1953- 1971, Introduction by David McCullough

39. The Wise Men, Walter Isaacson and Evan Thomas

40. The First Cold Warrior, Harry Truman, Containment, and the Remaking of Liberal Internationalism, Elizabeth Edwards Spalding

41. Another Such Victory, President Truman and the Cold War, 1945-1953, Arnold A. Offner

45. The Working White House, text by Hayes Johnson; photos by Frank Johnston

47. Churchill at War 1940-45, Lord Moran

48. The Last Lion Winston Spencer Churchill, William Manchester and Paul Reid

49. Truman Defeats Dewey, Gary A. Donaldson

50. The Upset That Wasn't, Harold I. Gulian

51. 1948, David Pietrusza

52. The Last Campaign, Zachary Karabell

53. Truman & Pendergast, Robert H. Ferrell

54. The Most Controversial Decision, Wilson D. Miscamble, C.S.C.

55. Truman's Dilemma, Paul D. Walker

56. Prompt & Utter Destruction, J. Samuel Walker

57. Downfall, Richard B. Frank

58. Genius in the Shadows, William Lanouette

59. A Safe Haven, Allis Raddosh and Ronald Raddosh

60. Truman and Noyes, Sidney O. Krasnoff

61. The Crucial Decade-and After, Eric F. Goldman

62. Iron Curtain, Anne Applebaum

63. On The Edge of the Cold War, Igor Lukes

64. Meeting at Potsdam, Charles L. Mee, jr.

65. Bloodlands, Timothy Snyder

66. Prague Winter, Madeleine Albright

67. Don't You Know There's a War On?, Richard R. Lingeman

68. Honorable Survivor, Lynne Joiner

69. Truman and the Russians, Herbert Druks

70. The National Security Legacy of Harry S. Truman, proceedings of 2003 Truman Legacy Symposium [TLS]

71. Congress and Harry S. Truman, a Conflict Legacy, proceedings of 2009 TLS

72. Israel and the Legacy of Harry S. Truman, proceedings of 2005 TLS

73. Retribution, Max Hastings

74. Chief Justice Fred M. Vinson of Kentucky, James E. St. Clair and Linda C Gugin

75. Harry's Farewell, introduction and edited by Richard S. Kirkendall

77. The Conquerors, Michael Beschloss

78. The President as Leader, Erwin C. Hargrove

79. Eleanor and Harry, edited by Steve Neal

80. Plain Speaking, Merle Miller

81. Strictly Personal and Confidential, edited by Monte M. Poen

82. The Words of Harry S Truman, selected by Robert J. Donovan

83. The Memorable Words of The Man from Missouri, selected and arranged by Ted Sheldon

84. The Trumans, Cass R. Sanduk

85. The Quotable Harry S. Truman, edited by T. S. Settel & Staff of Quote

91. Foreign Aid and the Legacy of Harry S. Truman, edited by Raymond H. Geselbracht. Vol. 10 of the Truman Legacy Series. Based on the Tenth Truman legacy Symposium, National Security, May 2012, Key West, Florida

92. George Marshall, a biography, Debi and Irwin Unger with Stanley Hirshson

93. Selling the Korean War, Steven Casey

94. Harry & Arthur, Lawrence J. Haas

95. The Year of Indecision, 1946, Kenneth Weisbrode

96. Killing the Rising Sun, Bill O’Reilly and Martin Dugard

97. 1946 The Making of the Modern World, Victor Sebestyen

98. The Candy Bombers, Andrei Cherny

99. The Berlin Airlift, Jon Sutherland & Diane Canwell

100. Implacable Foes, War in the Pacific 1944-1945, Waldo Heinrichs and Marc Gallicchio

101. The Accidental President, A. J. Baime

102. The Marshal Plan-Dawn of the Cold War, Benn Steil

103. The General vs. the President, H. W. Brands

104. A Preponderance of Power, Melvyn P. Leffler

105. A Force So Swift, Mao, Truman and the Birth of Modern China, 1949, Keven Peraino

106. The Allies, Winston Groom

107. The Presidential Character, James David Barber

108. The Presidency of Harry S. Truman, Donald R. McCoy

109. Truman’s Dilemma, Invasion or The Bomb, Paul D. Walker

110. Countdown, Chris Wallace

111. Dewey Defeats Truman, A. J. Baime

112. Saving Freedom, Joe Scarborough

113. Israel’s Moment, Jeffrey Herf

114. The War of Nerves: Inside the Cold War Mind, Martin Sixsmith

115. Between Containment and Rollback: The United States and the Cold War in Germany, Christian Ostermann

116. In the Shadow of FDR, William E. Leuchtenburg

117. Brother Truman, Allen E. Roberts

118. Proclaiming the Truman Doctrine, Denise Bostdorff

119. The Truman Era 1945-1952, I.F. Stone

120. The Awesome Power, Richard F. Haynes

121. Truman’s Triumphs: The 1948 Election and the Making of Postwar America, Andrew E. Busch

122. Mr. Truman’s War: The Final Victories of World War II and the Birth of the Postwar World, J. Robert Moskin

123. The Truman White House: The Administration of the Presidency, 1945 – 1953, Francis Howard Heller

124. The Trials of Harry S. Truman: The Extraordinary Presidency of an Ordinary Man, 1945 – 1953, Jeffrey Frank

125. Harry Truman's Independence: The Center of the World by Jon Taylor

126. Truman's Grandview Farm by Jon Taylor

127. Road to Surrender by Evan Thomas

128. From Failure To President by Clifton Truman Daniel

129. Six Months in 1945: FDR, Stalin, Churchill, and Truman-from World War to Cold War by Michael Dobbs

130. In the Shadow of Fear: American and the World in 1950 by Nick Bunker

131. A Cross of Iron by Michael J. Hogan
